intro: Camptosema ulei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Its flowers typically come in shades of purple, pink, and white, and are borne on short stalks. Camptosema ulei is widely cultivated as a popular ornamental plant due to its beauty and ease of care.
